quality_assessment: Introduction provides a strong, focused overview of Debtmap's unique AI sensor positioning. The document effectively communicates the value proposition but has minor inconsistencies with the features inventory regarding language support.

issues.description: Documentation states Debtmap 'focuses exclusively on Rust' and 'Multi-language support (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Go) is planned for future releases', but the features inventory indicates Python support already exists
issues.current_content: Debtmap focuses exclusively on Rust... Multi-language support (Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Go) is planned for future releases.
issues.should_be: Update to reflect that Python support exists according to features inventory: 'Multi-language code analysis (Rust, Python)'
issues.fix_suggestion: Update Current Status section to reflect actual multi-language capabilities. Either: (1) clarify Rust is primary with Python as secondary, or (2) update features.json if Python support is experimental/incomplete

issues.description: Features inventory includes extensive capabilities not mentioned in introduction: god object detection with split recommendations, boilerplate detection for macro-ification, functional analysis with purity detection, semantic classification, test quality analysis. While introductions shouldn't be exhaustive, some major differentiating features could be mentioned.
issues.current_content: Rust-first analysis - Full AST parsing, macro expansion, trait resolution; Coverage integration - Native LCOV support; Entropy analysis - Reduces false positives; Parallel processing
issues.should_be: Consider adding a brief mention of debt detection patterns (god objects, boilerplate, error handling) as key analysis capabilities that differentiate Debtmap
issues.fix_suggestion: Add a bullet under 'Analysis Capabilities' such as: 'Debt pattern detection - God objects, boilerplate code, error handling anti-patterns' to highlight these major features

issues.description: The introduction mentions 'compare debt across commits' but doesn't mention the dedicated 'compare' and 'validate_improvement' commands that are key features for tracking progress over time
issues.current_content: Progress tracking - Compare debt across commits
issues.should_be: Mention the compare command and validate_improvement command for tracking debt reduction in CI/CD workflows
issues.fix_suggestion: Expand workflow integration to: 'Progress tracking - Compare debt across commits with dedicated compare and validate-improvement commands'

positive_aspects: Clear and compelling positioning as an 'AI sensor' rather than prescriber - this differentiation is well articulated
Excellent contrast between what Debtmap provides vs doesn't provide - helps set accurate expectations
Practical quick start examples with real, working command lines including AI integration patterns
Strong target audience definition covering multiple user personas (AI-assisted developers, teams, CI/CD engineers, legacy maintainers)
Well-structured with clear sections: What, AI Sensor Model, Quick Start, Features, Status, Audience, Getting Started
Practical quick tip at the end ('Start with debtmap analyze . --format markdown --top 5') guides new users
All internal links are valid and point to existing documentation files
Focused messaging - avoids feature overload in favor of clear value proposition
improvement_suggestions: Reconcile 'Rust-only' statement with features inventory showing Python support - clarify current state
Add brief mention of debt pattern detection (god objects, boilerplate) under Analysis Capabilities
Consider adding link to metrics-reference.md in the Signal Generation section for users wanting deeper detail
Consider mentioning the TUI guide for interactive exploration as an alternative to CLI piping
Add brief note about validate command for CI/CD gates since it's mentioned but not linked
